intro: Malacocarpus, commonly known as the false tulip, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their showy, often bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. They typically grow in woodland or shady areas and have a clump-forming habit. The leaves are usually basal, linear, and persist through the growing season.
